channel.title: Monash Bioinformatics Platform
channel.description: Recent content on Monash Bioinformatics Platform

item.title: About
item.description: Informal Bioinformatics Seminars These seminars vary a lot, from highly technical and statistical discussions to light introductions to new technologies and methods like single cell genomics, image informatics and targeted proteomics.

item.title: Borrowing strength in numbers: some ideas for bulk and single-cell RNA-seq analysis
item.description: High-throughput data generation technologies are driving discovery in biomedical science

item.title: Singscore for gene-set scoring in cancer research
item.description: The recent decade has seen a massive growth in the availability of large transcriptomic data sets for cell line collections (e.g. the Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia; CCLE), and patient tumour samples with matched clinical information (e.g. The Cancer Genome Atlas; TCGA)

item.title: Integration of miR-196 and retinoic acid signaling in limb development
item.description: Integration of miR-196 and retinoic acid signaling in limb development and patterning Retinoic acid signaling can be inhibited with a drug treatment

item.title: ATACSeq - What's a peak anyway? By Michael See from Monash Bioinformatics Platform
item.description: Assay for Transposase Accessible Chromatin with high-throughput sequencing (ATACSeq) is a method for probing open regions of chromatin in the genome

item.title: Beggars at a banquet: stop only thinking about significance and start thinking about measurement accuracy with topconfects
item.description: Paul Harrison Monash Bioinformatics Platform RNA System laboratory Abstract In this talk I will describe ranking and selecting differentially expressed genes based on confidence bounds on the log fold change, while still properly adjusting for multiple-testing, using my Bioconductor package “topconfects”.

item.title: Galaxy Australia infrastructure and what we do with all that reference data
item.description: The talk will be about how Galaxy Australia’s infrastructure has been spread out around the country using Pulsar and the Cern Virtual Managed File System (CVMFS.)

item.title: Clinical Bioinformatics at VCGS : Turbo charging clinical genomics for the modern era
item.description: As one of the largest genetic pathology laboratories in Australia, the Victorian Clinical Genetics Services is on the forefront of much of what is going on in the the world of clinical genomics and the associated bioinformatics

item.title: Genomic Epidemiology for Bacteria Outbreaks
item.description: Epidemiology studies using whole genome sequencing (WGS) have been popularized because they allow a very detailed association of phenotypes to a range of genomic components, as well as they allow the initial classification of isolates with higher accuracy than traditional methods

item.title: Bacterial whole genome assembly of Oxford Nanopore reads
item.description: Long-read sequencing platforms from Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) are transforming the world of genome assembly

item.title: Is MinION reads sufficient to generate perfect bacterial genomes?
item.description: Nanopore sequencing has come into focus, especially for bacterial genomics, due to its ability to produce ultra-long reads that are essential for producing complete circular genomes

item.title: Nanopore squiggle adventures
item.description: The management of raw nanopore sequencing data poses a challenge that must be overcome to accelerate the development of new bioinformatics algorithms predicated on signal analysis

item.title: Is your Nanopore FOMO justified? Where Nanopore is at and how to get a piece of the action
item.description: Nanopore sequencing has been marketed as the all portable, cheap and easy to answer to long reads

item.title: Mitch: Multivariate pathway enrichment for multi-omics and single-cell profiling data
item.description: Inference of biological pathway activity via gene set enrichment analysis is a frequently used approach in the interpretation of clinical and other omics data

item.title: crisscrosslinkeR: An R package for the identification and visualization of protein–RNA and protein–protein interactions captured by crosslinking with mass spectrometry
item.description: Unbiased detection of protein–protein and protein–RNA interactions within ribonucleoprotein complexes are enabled through crosslinking with mass spectrometry, but different methods detect different types of molecular interactions

item.title: A slimy situation: Uncovering the composition and mechanism of the slime secretion from Sepiadariidae using integrated ‘Omics and microscopy
item.description: Sepiadariidae are a small species of benthic bobtail squid distributed along the Southern Indo-Pacific coast of Australia

item.title: How bioinformatics and WGS has transformed international pathogen surveillance
item.description: Advances in whole genome sequencing and bioinformatics have transformed public health and clinical microbiology

item.title: Data analysis and the Future of Respiratory Medicine
item.description: Building a robust model for disease is a necessary part of developing a cure

item.title: Enabling academic research and clinical genomics at AGRF bioinformatics
item.description: With the increased adoption of genomic technologies in an increasingly diverse range of industries there is more need than ever for bioinformatics support

item.title: Correlation between predictive proteins and the lipidome of colorectal cancer and recurrent liver metastasis
item.description: Bowel cancer is the second most commonly diagnosed cancer for both men and women in Australia

item.title: Code Version Control with Git
item.description: Version control is a type of system that allows you to keep track of changes made to your code over time

item.title: A suite of Bioinformatics tools to call and explore time-course mutations from RNA-Seq
item.description: RNA Sequencing allows researchers to study the cancer genome from different perspectives than just differential expression analyses

item.title: Classifying DNA mismatch repair variant pathogenicity using protein structure and function predictions
item.description: The DNA mismatch repair (MMR) mechanism plays an important role in maintaining genome integrity by correcting small mutations that can arise from DNA damage or from mistakes made during replication and recombination

item.title: ASPREE sub-study on clonal haematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP) – musings of working up a targeted amplicon panel, a work in progress
item.description: ASPREE (ASPrin in reducing effects of the elderly) is a large prospective cohort study looking at the effects of low-dose aspirin in an otherwise healthy elderly population

item.title: Understanding whole genomes with identity by descent networks
item.description: Genome-wide association studies typically focus on discovery of one or more SNPs correlated with a phenotype of interest

item.title: Discoverability bias and its influence on gene-set testing
item.description: Gene-set enrichment analyses are the most commonly used class of analyses for distilling genomics data into biological knowledge

item.title: 3D Cardiomics: Unravelling the spatial transcriptome of the heart
item.description: An understanding of spatial gene expression and regulation is key to uncovering developmental and physiological processes, and accordingly, disease processes

item.title: Systematic profiling of long non-coding RNAs in breast cancer
item.description: To date, the focus of post genome wide association studies (post-GWAS) has been the impact of regulatory variants on the expression of protein-coding genes
